hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Beta Compression During Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a low-volatility consolidation phase (ATR(14) < 2.5% of price) during NEUTRAL regime, altcoin/BTC pairs that have shown 30-day beta > 1.5 will experience mean-reverting compression toward beta = 1, creating short-term trading opportunities.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During low-volatility periods, high-beta altcoins tend to compress as speculative flows diminish. The 30-day beta > 1.5 indicates excessive sensitivity that often reverts when BTC volatility drops. Recent underperformance suggests oversold conditions in these pairs.
entry_conditions: Altcoin underperforms BTC by > 3% over past 24h

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position reaches beta of 1.2 or altcoin outperforms BTC by 5%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Beta expands beyond 1.8 or altcoin underperforms by additional 5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: High-beta altcoins continue expanding beta (>2.0) despite low BTC volatility for 5+ consecutive days
